pullRequest.title: chore(ci): add TCK tests to build
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description

Adds steps to the build pipeline to run the BPMN TCK tests against the current version of Zeebe.

Related issues
closes #5595
Definition of Done
Code changes:

 The changes are backwards compatibility with previous versions
 If it fixes a bug then PRs are created to backport the fix to the last two minor versions

Testing:

 There are unit/integration tests that verify all acceptance criterias of the issue
 New tests are written to ensure backwards compatibility with further versions
 The behavior is tested manually
 The impact of the changes is verified by a benchmark

Documentation:

 The documentation is updated (e.g. BPMN reference, configuration, examples, get-started guides, etc.)
 New content is added to the release announcement

beforeCommit.message:
Revert "chore(ci): run TCK tests in offline mode"

This reverts commit a5860aad2621c1d57c6b7380cdafebadd41dbfd0.

The offline mode didn't work, because there is one dependency which is not downloaded by default; a better solution needs to be found.

afterCommit.message: chore(ci): add TCK tests to build

nodes.bodyText: Would it be possible to just collect this from a nexus? Then curl wouldn't have to be installed.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,12 @@
+FROM camunda/zeebe:current-test
+
+RUN apt-get -qq update
+RUN apt-get install --no-install-recommends -qq -y curl
+
+RUN mkdir /usr/local/zeebe/exporters
+RUN curl -L https://github.com/zeebe-io/zeebe-hazelcast-exporter/releases/download/0.10.0/zeebe-hazelcast-exporter-0.10.0-jar-with-dependencies.jar --output /usr/local/zeebe/exporters/zeebe-hazelcast-exporter-jar-with-dependencies.jar

nodes.bodyText: Can't we release bpmn-tck versions and use mvn's packaging powers?
